<!-- edited by Noelle Murata [fiveinchpixie@gmail.com]  -->


The `url` module provides functionality for the parsing and retrieving of URLs.

constructors.name: URL

params.name: source
params.description:
A string to be converted into a URL. If `source` is not a valid URI, this
constructor will throw an exception.

params.name: base
params.description: An optional string used to resolve relative `source` URLs into absolute ones.

constructors.description:
The URL constructor creates an object that represents a URL,  verifying that
the provided string is a valid URL in the process.  Any API in the SDK which
has a URL parameter will accept `URL` objects, not raw strings, unless
otherwise noted.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a string representation of the URL.

properties.name: scheme
properties.description: The name of the protocol in the URL.

properties.name: userPass
properties.description: The username:password part of the URL, `null` if not present.

properties.name: host
properties.description: The host of the URL, `null` if not present.

properties.name: port
properties.description: The port number of the URL, `null` if none was specified.

properties.name: path
properties.description: The path component of the URL.

name: toFilename

returns.description: The converted native file path as a string.

params.name: url
params.description: The URL, as a string, to be converted.

description:
Attempts to convert the given URL to a native file path.  This function will
automatically attempt to resolve non-file protocols, such as the `resource:`
protocol, to their place on the file system. An exception is raised if the URL
can't be converted; otherwise, the native file path is returned as a string.

name: fromFilename

returns.description: The converted URL as a string.

params.name: path
params.description: The native file path, as a string, to be converted.

description: Converts the given native file path to a `file:` URL.
